main event: A silver, disc-shaped object with a translucent appendage was observed for 1 hour and 50 minutes over Kodiak, Yakutat, Alaska.
interesting points: The object had a gentle side-to-side motion and maintained a constant speed.
Radar tracked two slow-moving objects heading southeast at an average speed of 25 knots, but the aircraft pilots were unable to visually confirm the objects.

A Coast Guard helicopter pilot estimated the object to be approximately 29,000 feet directly above him, describing it as twin-lobed, about the size of a hangar, and resembling a plastic dry cleaning bag.
Observers reported the object appeared to drift with the wind, with no change in altitude or size noted.
Some observers compared the object to a radiosonde balloon, but it was determined not to have been launched from any of the balloon release areas in Alaska.
sighted object: silver, disc-shaped object with a translucent appendage
witnesses: U.S. Army, U.S. Navy, Coast Guard personnel
photographs: yes, but no photographs included in the report
